article_title: Fixing American Health Care, One State At A Time

article_metadata.author: The Apothecary

og.description: By Rep. JAMES LANKFORD The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act has fostered intense debate on the delivery of health care over the past five years. We are now five months into the six-month roll out of Obamacare, and fewer than one-quarter of Americans believe the President's health care law will actually improve their family’s health care. Americans know there are problems in health care delivery, but they do not want Washington, D.C. to manage their personal health choices. Long wait times, inefficient systems, dysfunctional web sites, fewer choices and higher costs are all symptoms of the problem. But state legislatures have found a solution.
og.title: The Health Care Compact: Fixing American Health Care, One State At A Time
